title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 177.5 - Duties of the director of the office of the ombudsman
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 177.5 - Duties of the director of the office of the ombudsman

State Regulations

The director of the office of the ombudsman shall: (a) provide administrative supervision to the
ombudsmen and staff; (b) establish
procedures to ensure that ombudsman services are made available to every youth
under the jurisdiction of the division; (c) coordinate meetings of the Independent

Review Board and the activities of its members; (d) coordinate activities of the ombudsmen
with the Independent Review Board and other units within the
division; (e) fully participate in
the division's policy development process; (f) report to the Independent Review Board, the director of the division, the executive deputy director, other appropriate
deputy directors, the general counsel to the division and other appropriate
division staff, the grievances and complaints of youth and the status of such
grievances and complaints, and report on the progress of implementation of
statutes, court orders, court decisions, court stipulations, regulations and
policies affecting the legal rights of youth under the jurisdiction of the
division. The report shall indicate whether a reported issue, complaint or
grievance has been resolved and the manner in which it was resolved, and the
status of implementation of recommendations or directives made by the director
of the division with regard to previously reported issues, grievances or
complaints; (g) prepare a monthly
report for the director of the division on the activities of the office of the
ombudsman. Such monthly report shall contain statistical data and information
indicating: the number of youth served by the ombudsmen; the number and types
of complaints, grievances or issues brought to the attention of the ombudsmen; the number of facilities visited by the ombudsmen; the number of investigations
conducted by the ombudsmen; the number of hearings in which the ombudsmen were
involved; and the number and nature of contacts made by ombudsmen to persons or
agencies external to the division on behalf of youth under the jurisdiction of
the division. Notes

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
